description.narrative: UNHCR is a key player in addressing protection challenges for refugees and migrants along the Mediterranean route. The efforts are taking place in the countries of origin and transit (Algeria, Burkina Faso, Chad, Egypt, Ethiopia, Libya, Mali, Mauritania, Morocco, Niger, Senegal and Sudan) and can help reduce further migration flows. Activities include information campaigns on risks and realistic outcomes of the journey, strengthening local authorities 'capacity to deal with migration and protection, assistance for migrants' voluntary return and refugee integration in host communities and resettlement, desert rescue operations, protection of unaccompanied children, assistance to victims of gender-based violence, surveillance of detention centers in Libya and the evacuation of vulnerable refugees from Libya to Niger in order to further resettlement. Reports on these activities are available from https://reporting.unhcr.org/sites/default/files/gr2019/pdf/GR2019_English_Full_lowres.pdf#_ga=2.241443522.1161942469.1621970551-1103233004.1619619467
